# Sai Surbehera

Sai Surbehera is a Machine Learning Engineer for Walmart's Algorithmic Search Experience Team, specializing in synthetic data generation for navigation. Holds a Masterâ€™s in Computer Science from Columbia University and an undergraduate degree in Information from the University of Michigan. Professional experience includes:

- Synthetic data generation for navigation and search experience optimization at Walmart Search, focusing on improving algorithmic search performance.
- Development of price prediction algorithms, cold start models, and click-through rate (CTR) prediction models at Walmart Search, leveraging machine learning for e-commerce applications.
- Implementation of geo-coding algorithms at Philadelphia Inquirer and Columbia Journalism, enabling location-based data processing and analysis.
- Construction of information extraction pipelines at American Family Insurance, automating structured data extraction from unstructured sources.
- Design of relation extraction pipelines at Mindgram, facilitating identification and mapping of relationships within datasets.
- Development of knowledge graph search and entity linking systems at University of Michigan Giving, supporting advanced search and semantic data retrieval.
- Creation of theme-matching algorithms and summarization systems at University of Stellenbosch, enabling automated content analysis and summarization.
- Fraud detection using GraphSage at AAA Insurance, applying graph neural networks to identify anomalous patterns and prevent fraudulent activity.

Personal interests include working on independent projects, reading and writing about philosophy, and listening to music during free time.
